skill.author: BrownFineSecurity

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. This skill only provides instructions for an AI to help users use the external wsdiscovery command-line tool. No network calls, filesystem access, or code execution are performed by the skill itself. The actual scanning capability depends on the external wsdiscovery binary being installed separately.

content.user_title: Discover ONVIF cameras and IoT devices
content.value_statement: Finding network devices like ONVIF cameras requires understanding the WS-Discovery protocol. This skill provides guidance for discovering and enumerating WS-Discovery enabled equipment on your network using the wsdiscovery tool.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through WS-Discovery protocol scanning
Help configure target hostname or IP address for scanning
Display discovered device information (IP, ports, device types, manufacturer details)
Support verbose mode for full XML response viewing
Guide network broadcast scanning for comprehensive device discovery
limitations: The wsdiscovery binary must be installed separately on the system
Only discovers devices that support the WS-Discovery protocol
Cannot scan networks without proper authorization
Does not perform vulnerability testing or credential exploitation

best_practices: Obtain proper authorization before scanning any network you do not own
Use the quiet format option when you only need device counts or summary information
Combine with onvifscan skill for comprehensive device testing after discovery
anti_patterns: Assuming all discovered devices are secure or trustworthy
Using discovered device endpoints without proper security assessment

faq.question: What is WS-Discovery protocol?
faq.answer: WS-Discovery is a network protocol used by ONVIF cameras, printers, and IoT devices to advertise their services on a network using multicast/broadcast messages.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: Yes, the wsdiscovery command-line tool must be installed separately. This skill provides instructions for using it once installed.

faq.question: What devices will this find?
faq.answer: Only devices that support the WS-Discovery protocol. This includes most ONVIF cameras, network video recorders, and some printers and IoT devices.

faq.question: Is network scanning legal?
faq.answer: Scanning networks you do not own or have permission to test may be illegal. Always obtain proper authorization before scanning.

faq.question: How is this different from onvifscan?
faq.answer: wsdiscovery discovers devices advertising on the network. onvifscan tests discovered devices for ONVIF compatibility and vulnerability testing.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: Three formats: text (default, human-readable with colors), JSON (machine-readable), and quiet (minimal output).
